title.narrative: Kampala Institutional and Infrastructure Development Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Kampala Institutional and Infrastructure Development Project is to improve institutional efficiency of Kampala City Council (KCC) through implementation of the Strategic Framework for Reform (SFR). The reallocation is necessary to accommodate increase in consultancies cost from SDR 4,400,000 to SDR 6,700,000 to support the extension of consultancy contracts for project implementation for the additional two year period, and the need to pay compensation for involuntary resettlement under the Resettlement Action Plan (RAP) of SDR 1,155,000 from the credit in order to avoid any further delays in the implementation of civil works which cannot start before the payment of the associated involuntary resettlement cost. The closing date for the project will be extended from December 31, 2010 until December 31, 2012. The extension is necessary to allow KCC to complete the implementation of the planned project activities and in particular, to make up for the delays caused by parliamentary approval of the credit, which delayed the effectiveness of the credit by one year. This will be the first extension of the project.

condition.narrative: The PIE has established a Procurement and Disposal Unit
The Recipient shall cause the PIE to open and maintain the Escrow Account in the Bank of Uganda for compensation to the AffectedPersons
The Recipient shall make the proceeds of the Financing available to the Project Implementing Entity under a subsidiary loanagreement
The Recipient shall notify the Association the entity to carry out the responsibilities of KCC upon Implementation of theConstitution Amendment
The Subsidiary Agreement has been executed on behalf of the Recipient and the Project Implementing Entity (PIE)

title.narrative: Increase in public satisfaction in service delivery in (a) Roads, (b) Drainage and (c) Solid waste

comment.narrative: Phase 1 Roads (9.8Kms) completed. Phase 2 Roads (3.11 Kms) and Lubigi channel to be completed before project closing on December31, 2013.
Level of satisfaction as measured by the second and last citizen Report card Report.

title.narrative: Comp 2: Primary drainage channel expanded and lined (Kms)

comment.narrative: Target will be achieved by project closing.

By end of November 2013, Contractor had completed 96% of the civil works. Remaining 4% to be completed before project closing byDecember 31, 2013. KCCA hasstepped up its supervisory function by putting six dedicated staff on site to ensure timely completionof the remaining 4% of the works before project closure.
Total actual is now 12.01Km (Phase 1 - 8.9Kms and Phase 2 - 3. 11 Kms)
Phase 1 roads totaling 8.9Kms is completed and handed over to KCCA and is being used. Contract for phase 2 Road works totaling 3.11Kms is to be completed before December 31, 2013.

title.narrative: Comp 3: KCC utilizing results of annual Citizens Score Card to measure service delivery satisfaction

comment.narrative: Target achieved
The second Annual Citizen's Report Card was the last, planned under the project.
Actual total on completion (phase 1 - 8.9Kms and phase 2 - 3.11 Kms) will be 12.01 Kms.

Phase 1 roads totaling 8.9 Kms has been completed and handed over to KCCA. Phase 2 of Roads works totaling 3.11 Kms is 96%complete. Remaining 4% will be completed before project closing on December 31, 2013.

title.narrative: Comp 1: Reduction in building plan permit approval processing

comment.narrative: target of 2 months was agreed during MTR
Approval of building plan permit reduced from 1 year to an average of 2 months

title.narrative: Increase the % share of KCC own source revenue spent on service delivery

comment.narrative: New target of 34% agreed during MTR
This target has been achieved. A new target of 34% was agreed upon for closing date. Bulk of KCCA OSR is spent on service deliverysince wages and salaries are paid by central government.

title.narrative: Average traffic growth on KIIDP upgraded roads
Comp 1: Percentage of property rate demand notes issued to property owners

comment.narrative: MTR revised the target to 100%
Base line was 30% and target 90%. As of Nov 2013 KCCA had issued 100% of the property demand notes.

title.narrative: Comp 2: Poor quality bitumen roads and associated drains improved and strengthened (Kms)

comment.narrative: Dropped after restructuring.

This activity has been dropped during restructuring of the project since all roads maintenance in the country are now being fundedunder the Uganda National Road Funds. The project efficiency and PDO which is institutional strengthening still holds.

title.narrative: number of people directly affected by floods along Lubigi channel

comment.narrative: new target of 33.5 Billion agreed during MTR

Target over achieved. KCCA Revenue Directorates instituted a number of measures (documenting and mapping all revenue, tax payerssensitization, partnering with URA through data base sharing, introduction of revenue audit system, introduction of revenue servicestandards, in-house mentoring of staff , and decentralization of revenue collection to Divisions) which have resulted into morethan double revenue increase from base year.
Target was revised from UGX3 billion to UGX0.5 billion.
Target met and over performed. KCCA has fully paid verified overdue liabilities and not contracting new liabilities.
